intro: Leptotes glaucophylla, commonly known as the silver-leafed daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray leaves and small, daisy-like white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads. Leptotes glaucophylla is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
